snippet: To keep his Bollywood theater in Queens from going under, Somasundaram Gunasegaram started showing American movies. But he is already $100,000 behind on rent.
abstract: Corey Kilgannon Character Study column on Somasundaram Gunasegaram, owner of the Jackson Heights Cinema, a1924 movie theater in Queens; Gunasegaram, an immigrant from Sri Lanka, got his start in cinema by showing Indian films to give immigrants a taste of home, but his business has declined with the proliferation of DVDs and he has turned to mainstream Hollywood films to stay afloat.
lead_paragraph: To keep his Bollywood theater in Queens from going under, Somasundaram Gunasegaram started showing American movies. But he is already $100,000 behind on rent.

headline.seo: Gone Hollywood, Bollywood Theater in Queens Still Struggles
